1.content:
"Hey! You! Stop!" A voice behind you calls. You turn around slowly and see a figure running toward you. It's dark, and the figure is completely black in shadow.

"Who is that?" You call out as you reach for your PLS. A stowaway? Could be, or it could be a crewmember, but you don't want to take any chances. The power in engineering went out and now you got stuck trying to fix it. It would be really bad to be attacked now. "Where's my PLS?" You whisper as you pat your side, finding no weapons.

The figure is still coming closer.

"Stop! Who's there?" You yell, "I've got a PLS, don't come any closer!"

The figure stops. "It's me, Captain Marlson. Who are you?"

You breathe a sigh of relief and call out...
1.title: Beginning

11.content:
"It's me, Devin Porter!" You call out.

"Oh, jeeze, Officer Porter!" Brea said exhaling heavily. "You nearly gave me a heart attack! What are you doing down here?"

"Trying to fix the power outage." You turn around and bang on the power cells. "Without much luck."

"Nothing is working. The crash shook everything up. We're lucky we have any power at all."

"Yeah," You agree.

"We're assembling outside, Porter, come out when you give up." Brea smiled and carefully picked her way out.

You watch her leave and sigh heavily. Picking up a wrench, you study the power cell circuit again, this time finding something odd.

(What is it?)
11.title: I'm Devin Porter

choices: shove your hand in to find the slug
wipe off the mucus and leave
111.content:
"Eewww," You mutter under your breath, realizing what the shiny substance is. "It looks like someone blew their nose on the power cell!"

What strikes you as really odd is the fact that it appears to be in the form of a trail. A trail that looks like it's leading into the power cell.

Bracing yourself, you work yourself up to touching it, and tentatively finger the gross, mucus-like mess. It feels like wet silly putty, or maybe really runny jello. Almost the consistancy of the white of an egg.

Yes... the white of an egg. That's what it looked like, too. Clear, but with whitish flecks in it.

You suddenly remember what else it reminds you of. Slug slime.

You now...
111.title: Mucus-like substance

1111.content:
You take a deep breath and carefully insert your hand into the power cell, knowing that you might accidentally electrocute yourself. You also know that if you don't get the slug out, it could turn off power for the whole ship.

Reaching around inside, you wince as you feel something big and slimy. You grab it and slowly begin to pull it out.

The huge slug finally comes free from the cell and you look at it carefully. In the dark, it looks weird and you wonder what kind of slug it is. Almost black and without much form, you begin to realize that what you are holding isn't a slug. It's some sort of alien.
1111.title: Reaaaching in...

choices: Ignore it and continue to work on the power
11111.content: You drop it. Maybe you should get one of the crew down here to help you with the problem and to decide what to do with the alien. You pick up the alien one more time when you start to scream. The alien has burrowed into your arm. It hurts like hell. Afer it was finished into your arm the pain goes away. You look at your arm and sees that a bump on it moving up your arm! Then thew pain started again.
11111.title: Pain

111112.content: You leave it alone and continue to work on the power. After a few minutes you look at your arm again and the bump had moved from your arm to your cheek. Maybe you better go see the doctor after all. You make it to the doctor's door when you pass out.
111112.title: Passed Out

choices: You lay back down on the table and close you eyes, maybe this is just a dream
1111121.content: You wake up and you find yourself on a metal table. Around the table are what look like...Aliens!! You sit up on the table and you see through a window a purple planet. That's impossible, it would take The Luna five years to reach the planet you are looking at.
1111121.title: Aliens!!

choices: You wake up on The Luna
You wake up on the metal table
11111211.content: You leap off the table and you start to run. Before you can get very far a tentacle from one of the aliens grabs you by the leg and pulls. You land on your stomach and you find yourself being pulled back to the table. Even though you don't see any mouths the alien starts to talk, "You can't run." it says. You get put back on the table and the aliens put something in your mouth and you fall asleep.
11111211.title: You Can't Run

choices: You stop screaming after Dos Grey tells you to shut up
111112111.content: You wake up and you see Dana Pendrell, Dos Grey, and Alex Reed standing over you. You are back on The Luna. You sit up on the table and you see yourself in a mirror on the wall. There is something wrong, your head is on backwards. You look down and find yourself looking at your back. You scream.
111112111.title: Something's Wrong

1111121112.content: "Can you please shut up? Or will I have to shut you up." Dos Grey says. You stop screaming. "Can somebody help me?" you ask. "Yes, I can but you have to hold still." the ship's doctor says.
1111121112.title: Do As The Dactor Says

choices: Caught alive, the alien not so spontaneously combusts.
11112.content:
You hold the slug between two fingers and go racing for the lab.

"Devin, what in the blazes are you doing?" Dos calls. "I'm trying to sleep."

"Alien oozing on our ship - no need for alarm," you call back.

"Alien - whaaa?" Kamira demands.

You quickly burst into the lab and drop thew little slug into a glass jar. "Think we can figure out what this is?" you ask.

"Kamira eyes it over her glasses. "Well, we'll do our best."

"What is this about an alien?" Anorian calls, stepping into the lab.

"You don't want to look - trust me," you tell her, knowing all too well how squemish she is.

Kamira pulls the slug up to a microscope for a closer look. "This is odd..."
11112.title: Alien Eating The Ship

choices: Can you go get me the Optitrope Computer?
I need you to take out a skimmer and make a map
112.content:
"Well there's the problem!" Quickly you reconnect the router, and look around as the lights slowly flicker back on. "Well, that takes care of that."

You slam the power cell door shut and kick your tools into the corner. "Better go find Brea." You decide.

Exiting out the main airlock, you immediately see the rest of the crew sitting around the optitrope, trying vainly to put it together.

"No! Give me that!" Dana cried yanking something out of Alex's hand. "I'm doing that part!"

"But I'm putting the mapping device together!" Alex yelled, grabbing the thing back.

"Give it a rest, you two." Kal said snatching the coveted item.

You walk up to the group and take a seat on the ground.

Brea sees you and says "Porter!..."
112.title: Disconnected Router

choices: Hurry up! Try to lose him/her/it!
1121.content:
Brea wipes sweat off her brow and tosses a bent metal piece of something. It hits the grass with a swoosh and a twang. "Porter, go get me the Optitrope Computer, would you?"

"Sure, Captain. Is it in the auxilliary storage bay off the bridge--"

"I don't know!" Brea cuts you off in exasperation, "Everything got moved around in the crash. It could be in the mess hall for all I know, just find it."

"Okay..." You mutter under your breath and turn on your heel. Back inside the ship, you notice again how dark it is inside. Even with the lights back on its much dimmer than outside in the bright sunlight -- of course, the sun of this planet is a lot brighter than Sol, but then again the planet is a bit further from it than Earth is from Sol.

Making your way up to the bridge, which would give you access to some of the storage bays, you pick your way through the debris, garbage and cargo that got scattered through the halls and passage ways.

A shiver runs down your spine. You stop dead in your tracks.

Was that footsteps behind you?

Despite yourself you start to shiver a little.
1121.title: Fetch, boy.

1122.content:
"Porter, I want you to take a skimmer out and map the surrounding area, okay?" She thrusts the map-making materials at you along with the activation card for one of the few working skimmers.

"Alone, sir?" You hesitate. You don't exactly want to go out there alone... but you're not scared, oh no. It just ... it's probably protocol or something to not go out alone... isn't it?

Brea barely seems to hear you "Uh, yeah... take one of those two with you..." She brushes you off with a wave of the hand and jerks his thumb in the direction of Dana and Alex.

Great. Maybe it would have been better to go alone than with one of those two crazies... You raise an eyebrow as you watch them fight over... well you can't tell what they're fighting over, you stopped caring about *that* day two of the mission.

So who do you take?
1122.title: Leave? eep.

choices: Nah, leave it to the professionals
113.content:
"Aeeiee!" You shout in surprise as you nearly electrocute yourself on the sparking wire.

Before you begin to think about the wire, you notice a turkey sandwich on the floor and your mouth waters. Reaching for it, you realize that it's Dana Pendrell's lunch. She'd be mad if you ate it... oh well.

You pick it up and hungrily devour it.

"MMMMMMM!" You exclaim, "That was mighty delicious, daddy-o. Now for that wire."

Hmmm... How to fix it? Should you try? Or call for help?
113.title: It's a wire! Be careful!!

1131.content:
You reach in carefully and grab the wire with two fingers. Sweating and breathing hard, you examine the power cell.

There are two wires that appear to be disconnected.

A green one.

A red one.

You close your eyes. "Am I in a bad bomb-scare movie or what?"
1131.title: Handy man, are we?

choices: Scream like a girl and try to run!
11311.content:
You connect the sparking wire to the red wire.

Nothing happens.

Suddenly the lights come on all around and you're temporarily disoriented. Shading your eyes, you stagger a moment while you adjust to the new light.

Something grabs your foot!!
11311.title: Here's Hoping!!!

choices: Pull out your PLS. No sense running... Again... <<;;
113111.content:
You scream like a girl as something grabs your foot! Blinded by the sudden bright lights you can't make out what or who it is, and you run like mad, screaming the whole way down the hall.

Finally your eyes adjust a little more and you hazard a peek over your shoulder... to see Dana Pendrell rolling on the floor in hysterical laughter.

Despite your mad adrenaline rush, you find the composure to stop yourself and regain a semblance of unaffectedness as you turn to face her. "WHAT was that!?"

She can barely talk through the laughter, and finally it dies down to wheezing. She gets up on her knees and wipes tears away from her eyes. "You should have seen the look on your face! It was priiiiiiiiceless!" She stands up and laughs.

"Yeah, haha very funny!"

"Yeah, well you ate MY sandwich you little twerp!" Dana suddenly gets angry, and almost all traces of humor are gone from her face.

"That wasn't very nice."

She laughs maniacally again. "You should have seen your face," She repeats. "You are SUCH a wuss! I mean, jeesh!" She mimics your stance and recreates the scene, pretending to be an exaggerated you being grabbed at the ankle and freaking out. "Aghhhhhhhh! Boogey man!" She doubles over in laughter again.

"Ha ha ha like I said, very--"

"Wait." Dana's blue eyes get wide and her smile drops into a frown. "Did you hear that?" A little panic is in her voice.

"Trying to get me again?" You chuckle a little and take a few steps toward her casually. "Well it's not working. Nice try, but it's a little too obvious--"

"NO!" She cuts you off.

She's shaking, you notice as you get closer. You stop and listen, still suspecting it to be a prank.

Tap tap. Scratch. Tap. Ping.

"What is that?" You ask.

You both lock eyes, neither really looking at the other, both with far away looks on your faces as you listen to the tapping get closer and closer.

"WHAT IS THAT!?" You start to get hysterical.

"I don't know!" She spins around, trying to pinpoint where it's coming from.

Suddenly you both come to the realization...

It's above you.
113111.title: Aghhhhhhh! *Girly scream*

choices: A maintenence robot working out what was wrong with the pipes
1131111.content: "RUUUUUUUN!" you scream setting off down the corridor faster then what was humanly possible seconds before. You turn around and see...
1131111.title: Run for it!

11312.content:
You take a deep breath... and connect the sparking wire to the green wire.

SPPPPPPPPPPAAAAAAAAAAKKKKKKKKKK!!!

10,000 volts of electricity run through your body and your skin boils and melts off your bones. Your internal organs burst and land on top of your skin, as your skeleton is stuck holding the wire, standing up right.

Finally, the power cell shorts out, leaving the entire ship in darkness, and you in a pile of ashes and bone.
11312.title: Cross your fingers!!!

choices: You go to the Optitrope right away.
You decide to stop off for a snack in the galley.
1132.content:
"Hehehe No way am I going to mess with that." You think to yourself as you pull out your Com. You nimbly dial Chris, the mechanic's, number. It chirps twice, and then his face appears in the little screen of the tiny box.

"Yeah? What is it, Devin?" Chris looks tired and dirty. Probably from working on the Life Support system for all those hours this morning, and then getting those skimmers back up after that... and then helping with the Optitrope...

"There's a sparking wire here at the power grid. I can't do anything about it unless I wanna fry myself."

"Wouldn't that be a shame." Chris mumbles. "Fine, I'll be down there in a while. Think you can take over up here assembling the Optitrope?"

"Sure thing."

"See ya."

"Yep." You turn off the com and stick it in your pocket. You chuckle to yourself. "That wasn't so hard..."
1132.title: Aie, I'm too much of a sissy to do it myself!

11322.content: Pleased with how well you handled the loose-wire thingy situation, you popmoff to the galley for some well deserved food. The Luna really hadn't been that deep into space when the accident had occurre, so the food was still better than the completely inedible andimagitively named 'nutrient biscuits', which studies had shown decreased the morale of ship shwose crew members had been forced into eating them by about 20%. You reach the small cabin, with just enough room for all seven of the Luna's crew members to eat, though Karl would have to stand in the doorway if he insisted on wearing his cowboy hat. You stride up to the vending machine capable of almost instantly producing nearly any food found anywhere on earth (though Mr. Gray was disappointed and irritated, in keeping with local tradition and custom, to discover that many of his favorite snacks weren't classified as 'food'). Humming, you declare to the machine "Surprise me!" And a large, roughly spherical object rolls out onto a tray at the bottom, next to a plate and some cutlery. You can't help but feel like you've seen it somewhere before, possibly on a movie... Moving on to another part of the song, you sit dwon and start prodding at the dish, the unidentifiable substances smeared over its rough brown surface, wondering where to start eating it, ass you lean over to look at it from above though, a dozen or so flaps suddnely fly open in all directions, and something inside leaps out. The bony thing lands on your face, thrashing crazily and hanging on with a half-dozen legs, while it seems to be doing something horribly remeniscent of kissing you. "Gah! It's on my face! The mess rations are trying to eat me! Help!" You scream falling over onto the floor, hands going to ypur face to wrench the bony, slimy thing off. "Hold still, Dev! I'll get it off!" You hear someone yell, and you suddenly fell something-flat, metallic, and very hard-slamming into your head repeatedly. "Dang! Persistent little bugger! Don't move!" before you can ask what he or she's going to do, you feel like you've been badly sunburned all over your head and shoulders. You groan as the thing comes, free, leaving a patch of mucus all over the front of your head, and it scuttled up the table, in to the thing impersonating a meal, and then out the door with shocking speed. "What the hell are those lunatics provisioning us with? Those rations almost bit my head off!" You look to your saviour, Alex Reed, holding a faintly smoking PLS in one hand and a frying pan in the other. "I don't think that that thing was food. I was just in the science lab, and scanners indicated there to be an unidentifiable lifefrom on board. Something about it makes it hard for the computers to indentify its exact location, but I could see it was in the galley area. Good thing I came in here to check it out. And haven't you seen any of the alien movies?! I think that it might be able to sense things in our memory that scare us, and might react instinctevly by morphing into their appearence; why it looked identicle to an exenomorph egg. C'mon, lets get after it before it can cause any more trouble!"
11322.title: Admittedly strongly influenced by Pollymorphs.

114.content:
Glistening in the overhead lights, the tiny insect twitches as you examine it. The little insect extends tiny wings and gingerly takes two steps toward you.

You make a disgusted face, and bring your hand up to squish it.

Suddenly, the bug jumps out at you!

It flies furiously toward your head, darting around you and buzzing angrily.

You wave your hands in front of your face, but the bug seems to know every move you're about to make, and is always out of the way before you can swat it.

It's eyes glow red and it makes a sudden dive for your neck!
114.title: AGH! THE KILLER BUG FROM HELL!

1141.content:
"AAAAAAAAAHHHHHH!" You scream as you turn around and begin to sprint. "HELP! Help me! Killer bug! Killer bug!"

You dart around the corner...

And run right into Dana Pendrell.

"Ow! You moron!" She screams, picking herself up from where she was thrown by the collision. "What's the matter with you?"

"There's a ... a..." You pant heavily, looking behind you for signs of the bug. "Bug..." You trail off, gesturing helplessly toward the power cell.

"Yeah." Dana makes a face and sizes you up. "A grown man like you afraid of a little bug, are we?"

"Well... you... you should watch where you're going."

"OOh, nice one. Did you run into me on purpose so you could use that little gem?" Dana says pushing past you gruffly.

"Where are you going?"

"To fix the power. While the rest of you have your power up on the top decks, I'm stuck down here in engineering, and guess what? We don't have any power. Now if you'll excuse me, I'll be getting along." Dana tosses her red hair over her shoulder and sighs heavily, walking in the direction you had come from.

"But there's some sort of alien insect over there. I don't think it's safe--" You begin to follow her--tentatively...

"Oh yeah." Dana scoffs, "Well I'll be sure to look out for your little bug."

"Listen," You grab her shoulder and turn her around to face you, "I know you don't like me, but I'm telling the truth, ok? There's something down there."

Dana pauses, and gives you a long, searching look. "Yes. Something is down there. The power cell, and now I'm going to go fix it." She shakes herself free of your grasp, but doesn't turn around.

"Dana... is something... wrong?"

For the first time you notice her face is pale, and she looks rather... ill... maybe a little dazed.

She looks up and...
1141.title: No! Please don't Kill me!

choices: "Hey!" ... A voice from down the hall!
11411.content:
Dana's blue eyes glow red for an instant, and as you blink, trying to make sense of that phenomenon, she lunges at you full force, knocking you to the ground. She opens her mouth, baring unusually sharp teeth... hungry looking teeth... and they're snapping towards your throat!

You try to wrestle her off you, but she seems even stronger than the usual her, and Dana's usually pretty strong. She pins your waist under her knees, rendering your flailing legs useless, and in one deft movement, pins both your wrists under her steel-like hands.

Writhing and whimpering under your breath, you attempt to break free as Dana bends down, her mouth open and her eyes hungry ... her teeth get closer and closer to your throat when...
11411.title: ...Dana? *whimper*

114111.content:
"Hey!" A voice from down the hall suddenly cuts through her growls and stops her cold. "What's going ON down there!?"

Dana looks up fearfully at the approaching figure and suddenly bolts for it, taking off down the labyrinth of hallways.

The figure approaches you and bends down, offering hands to help you up. "Hey man, are you okay? What happened?"

You look up into the person's face.
114111.title: Hey you!

choices: Give in... She could be the one...
11412.content:
She turns her pale blue eyes up to you, and as you step forward and begin to ask her if there's something wrong, she leans forward quickly and kisses you lightly on the mouth.

She takes half a step back, and looks almost as surprised as you feel, and then takes a full step forward into your arms as she kisses you again, longer and more passionately.

You admit to yourself that you've always had a slight "thing" for Dana, but... ... she's always been really mean to you, and she's really not *exactly* your type to begin with... maybe she's just a little too aggressive. But she's bright, beautiful, witty... like you! ... ... Your inner monologue rambles on confusedly. Suddenly you make up your mind and...
11412.title: ... Dana! *shocked look*

choices: Ignore it... everything's rolling around because of the crash
Check it out... maybe it's another weird alien bug thing or something
114121.content:
You pull away suddenly and look down. "Dana, we can't do this." You glance back at her face to find that it's fallen, and her eyes have a slightly glossed over look to them.

"I know..." She says softly.

A moment of awkward silence passes.

You playfully shove her "Hey, you gonna fix that power circuit or what, Miss Fix-it?"

She glares at you through mostly dried tears, "If you're done staring at me like an idiot I am." She turns gruffly on her heel and walks down the hall.

You decide to go meet up with the Captain and the others outside and start to head out. But then you hear a noise ... kind of like... tapping or... ... clicking? You can't quite put your finger on what the noise is... there! And some scratching...

You...
114121.title: No! It's wrong...

choices: Try coak Alex and Dana away from each other.
1142.content:
With uncanny deft and skill, you slam your
open palm into the bug and send it flying
against a wall. It splatters everywhere.

"Hm, anti-climatic," you think to yourself.

"Sonny, Brea is a-screamin for ya," you hear a
voice say. You turn around and see Kal
O'Conner, flashing that big dumb smile. His
oversized belt buckle reads "Don't Mess With
Texas", and his ridiculous leather cowboy hat
clashes with his generic commander uniform.

"Yeah, coming," you say, really unable to
stand his garish accent. He pats you on the
shoulder as you walk down the ramp.

Outside, you see Alex and Dana engaged in a
pretty serious conversation. Brea and Dos are
chatting about something, who knows. You
don't see Anorian, but you hear vomiting
somewhere.
1142.title: Meet the guys

choices: Holster your gun and see what's up.
11421.content:
You walk behind a boulder, and sure enough,
there is Anorian in the middle of a dry heave.
You walk up to him, and hold back his long
blonde hair, which already has pieces of gunk
in it.

"You okay there, bud?" You ask. He throws out
another moan and looks up.

"Oh God, I'm sick," he replies, unnecessarily,
and loses color in his face. You grimace.

"No, I couldn't notice," you say, sarcastically,
but he obviously misses it as he looks up, his
face full of conviction.

"I am, I mean look at me!" he cries. You look
around, trying to see what drove him to this.
Anorian had a tendency to puke at the drop of
a hat. Rumor was, at the Academy's final
exam, he threw up on the test, another cadet,
and the teacher.

"Yeah, I believe you," you say. "What's up?"

"Oh God, I don't know, it's just where we are, I
can't handle it," he replies. You pat him on the
head, turn away as he starts to throw up
again, and see something appear over the
horizon. It's too hazy to make out well, but it's
gaining speed right towards you.

"What the-" you start as you pull out your PLS
and disarm the safety. Anorian looks up and
sees it coming towards you and passes out.
You give him a fleeting glance before pointing
your sights on the creature, who is getting
closer still.
11421.title: Hold the hair back.

choices: Nudge Anorian with your foot and take Eugene back to meet the crew.
114211.content:
You decide the best strategy is to shoot first,
shoot again, shoot some more and then ask
questions, so you begin to pump round after
round of your PLS into the blob. It's getting
closer, and you can make out its shape, or
lack there of.

"Ow, stop that dammit, it hurts!" a voice says.
You think it's from the blob, but to make sure
you fire a couple more rounds into it. "I said
stop, man, come on!"

Thoroughly confused, you holster your PLS.
"Sorry, didn't mean that." You look down at
Anorian, who is sucking his thumb. You think
about screaming for help, but you're frozen in
fear. All you can do is look at the blob.

"Oh, its alright, don't worry about it. Hold on a
second, let me take a more favorable form."
Before your eyes, the blob contracts on itself,
grows arms, legs, a head, clothes, hair, and
all other details until finally an authentic
human stands before you. "Well?"

"Wow, you're really," you search for the right
word. "fat." He was quite portly. The new
person looks down at his gut, tries to suck it
in, but fails and loosens his belt a notch
instead.

"Hi, my name is Eugene."
114211.title: My name is Eugene.

1142111.content:
"Yeah, Eugene, sorry about shooting you and
all, you seem like an okay guy," you say,
awkwardly, really not knowing what to say after
you've just shot someone upwards of thirty
times.

"Don't worry about it, barely felt it. Well, I guess
I should tell you I'm not human." Duh, you
think, but you remain quiet. "I'm actually a
Zylogig. I'm here to warn you. I, unlike my
brethren, am quiet compassionate to, lesser,
species. "

"Warn me?" You ask, confused. "Warn me
about what?"

"We Zylogigs, well, we don't like to be
disturbed. And we have the inate ability to
shape shift into whatever we want. I'm actually
surprised you aren't already dead, we sent our
best troop to do it." You start to think back to
that bug with the weird red eyes you sent flying
into a wall.

"Oh, that bug? I kicked that thing's ass," you
respond, dismissing him with a wave of his
hand.

"What? You killed Dexterflamolam?" Eugene
screams, outraged. You notice his eyes faintly
turning red.

"Wait, how are you named Eugene, and he's
named, whatever he is named?" You ask, not
realizing the actual seriousness of the
situation.

"That doesn't matter! He was my brother! DIE!"
You then watch as his arm shifts into a giant,
ten foot long blade that comes down, barely
missing you. You collapse to the ground.
Above you, Eugene towers, smiling awfully.
1142111.title: Eugene is a mofo.

11421111.content:
You feel yourself about to wet yourself and let
out a blood curdling scream. Eugene cringes
as it pierces his ears, echoing off the hills far
in the distance.

"Good god man, have some dignity," he says
as he shakes his head. He raises the blade
again, then turns as he sees someone
coming.

"Anorian, Devon, we need a group talk." You
smile as you hear Brea approaching. "Who
the hell are you?" You turn to see her staring
Eugene down. He cringes noticeably under
her hard stare.

"I'm Eugene," he says, and you can't help but
laugh at how pitiful that name sounds in this
situation. Eugene gives you an annoyed look,
then turns his attention back to Brea. "DIE!!!!"

He swings hard at Brea, who deftly ducks
under and immediately reverts to a fighting
position. It's just then you remember she
used to be a Ultimate Fighting Champion, or
something like that. Eugene lunges again, but
trips over Anorian as he begins to rouse from
his slumber. As he falls, Brea delivers a
strong drop kick to his stomach.

Eugene collapses to the ground, holds his
stomach, and melts before their very eyes.
Brea isn't even sweating, and helps you and
Anorian to your feet.

"Are you alright? I came as soon as I heard
Anorian scream."
11421111.title: Brea cleans up.

11421112.content:
Right now, the only one that can save you is
Anorian. You turn to him, a hopeful look in your
eye, but feel crestfallen as you see him
charging away, into the hills, away from the
camp. You try to scream, but it gets caught in
your throat.

All you can do is watch as the blade comes
down right between your eyes.

In true Ray Bradbury style, your body parts are
taken back to the Zylogig headquarters,
reassembled, loaded with bombs, and sent
back to your camp.

The small amount of conscience you have left
allows you to realize that as soon as Brea
asks you where you've been, you detonate
and destroy them all.

God this planet sucked.
11421112.title: This...is...the...ennnnnd.

12.content:
"It's me, Trish Barrak!" You call out.

"Oh thank goodness!" Brea said, exhaling loudly, "I thought you were some sort of stowaway or something!"

"I nearly had a heart attack when I saw you." You confess rather sheepishly.

"What are you doing down here?" Brea asked coming closer.

"Trying to fix this damn thing." You bang on a power cell with a wrench. "Without any luck." You add with a bitter smile.

"Nothing works anymore." Brea shook her head, "Everything got all shook up in the crash. I'm surprised we even have oxygen."

"It wouldn't be too terrible if we didn't," You point out, "Because the atmosphere is breathable."

"True." Brea started to make her way out, "Speaking of which, we're meeting outside. Come on out when you give up."

"Ok." You sigh, turning back to the power circuits. "This is hopeless. I'm no mechanic. I'm a chemist for goodness sake!"

Something in the circuit panel catches a glimmer of light and you stop. On closer examination, you discover it to be...
12.title: I'm Trish Barrak

choices: reach your hand into where the trail leads
wipe off the mucus and leave
121.content:
"Eewww," You mutter under your breath, realizing what the shiny substance is. "It looks like someone blew their nose on the power cell!"

What strikes you as really odd is the fact that it appears to be in the form of a trail. A trail that looks like it's leading into the power cell.

Bracing yourself, you work yourself up to touching it, and tentatively finger the gross, mucus-like mess. It feels like wet silly putty, or maybe really runny jello. Almost the consistancy of the white of an egg.

Yes... the white of an egg. That's what it looked like, too. Clear, but with whitish flecks in it.

You suddenly remember what else it reminds you of. Slug slime.

You now...
121.title: Mucus

choices: A big bag with a huge money sign on it!
1211.content:
Making a face and bracing yourself, you carefully reach your hand in and feel around cautiously. Careful not to touch any wires that might be loose (which would probably electrocute you to death), you reach in until even your elbow is stuck in the hole.

Something warm is inside!

Without thinking, you recoil quickly, and then freeze. Taking a deep breath, you grab the slimy snake-like thing and begin to pull it out. If it got in any further, it would probably short out the entire power grid of the Luna. That would be bad.

"Feels like... a... slug?... a... blob of clay?" you think aloud.

The creature/object finally comes free and your eyes widen as your brain registers exactly what you have in your hand.
1211.title: Yeeech!

choices: Alex Reed is a space pirate who hides his loot here!
The ship used to be a galactic space bank!
12112.content:
"Oh my God!" You exclaim, "Money!"

You stare at the bag for a moment, puzzled over what it could possibly mean. Why would there be money stashed away in the ship?... unless...

Yes of course! That was it!
12112.title: Money!

choices: Yes! Alex, I'll be your Space Pirate Queen!
121121.content:
"That's right." A deep voice behind you says chillingly as you realize the ugly ugly truth. He's disturbingly close behind you, and as you hear a tiny click and charging noise, you realize he has a PLS pointed at you.

Slowly, you turn around.

Alex Reed stands before you with a PLS trained on you and a classy eye patch over his right eye.

"Alex you're a space pirate?" You still can't believe it.

"That's right Trish and I've got money hidden all over the ship. This crash was just a diversion so that I could safely get it all out of here without anybody getting wise to me. Unfortunately, you got wise to me." Alex smiles.

"Are... Are you going to kill me now?"

He smiles again, "Well, I was going to kill you all anyway... but I've always liked you. . . tell you what. I'll give you a choice. Come with me, and be my partner in crime, or I'll kill you."

The whole time you've been wondering whether or not you could kick the PLS out of his hands in time to get away... but... ... maybe you want to take the offer. What is it?
121121.title: Space Pirate Alex Reed?

choices: Knee him in the groin and run
1212.content:
You look quickly from side to side, and, seeing nobody watching you, casually close the panel door and begin to turn around. You stick your hands in your pockets and whistle a tune, inconspicuously making your way out of the ship.

On your way out, you suddenly become aware of a presence somewhere near, and you spin around quickly, scanning all 360 degrees.

Nothing.

"Hmmmm...." You start to say.

It's quiet.

Very quiet.

Something touches your shoulder and you scream! Spinning back around, you are shocked to see Alex Reed standing behind you. "Where did you come from!?"

"I was here the whole time." He says monotonously.

"Riiiiight." You know that something is wrong with him. Did he see you with that icky mucus stuff? Is he telling the Captain? "What are you doing here?"

"Just... you know... getting a bite to eat." He takes a step closer.

"Wha-what are you talking about? What do you mean?" You start to get anxious.

"What do you think I mean?" Alex's eyes are cold and unfeeling... so... alien...

Thinking quickly you...
1212.title: <Shifty Eyes...>

12121.content:
Your eyes fly open as you find yourself kissing Alex Reed hotly on the lips. He begins to place his hands on your shoulders, when you suddenly pull away.

"Uh... ... sorry... I slipped." You try to think of some explanation...

Alex only looks at you and lets a smile slip from one side of his mouth. "Hey..." He reaches out and takes your hand and...
12121.title: SMOOCH!

choices: I may like you... but I'm in love with someone else...
121211.content:
He holds your hand gently. "Trish... I've always had a ... thing for you, you know..."

"No, I don't know." You say coyly, twisting your fingers around his.

He smiles shyly. "Yeah."

You smile, too, and start to lean forward, to kiss him again.

He pulls away and says seriously, "But you know..."
121211.title: Awww how romantic... ^^

choices: Ask it questions. This is too weird.
1212111.content:
Alex's eyes glow red for an instant and he smiles coldly. It's a strange smile. You can't put your finger on it... but it's strange. Inhuman.

"I'm an alien, you know, Trish."

Before you have time to react at all, the grip on your hand becomes like a steel trap and he pulls you closer. You gasp as he opens his mouth revealing a row of steely sharp teeth.

His face melts in on itself and begins taking the shape of other crewmembers. Brea. Dana. Anorian. Kal. You.

You find yourself staring into your own smiling face.
1212111.title: This is not an episode of scooby doo...

choices: "The love of my life is Dana Pendrell."
"The love of my life is Anorian Johnson."
1212112.content:
"Trish... I like you. A lot." He begins, and drops his hold on your hand. "But..."

"But what?" You try to catch his eyes, but he won't lift them from the floor.

"But there's someone else." He finally blurts.

Your eyes open wide in shock and your mouth opens a little. "But but but..." You stammer.

Alex takes your hand again. "I wish I'd met you first, Trish. But ... I'm in love. And we're happy together."

You feel tears coming on. "Who is it?"

Alex smiles a little and says softly...
1212112.title: There's someone else...

choices: Pull out your PLS and zap him!
121212.content:
"RAWWWWWR!" Alex lets loose a horrifying, high pitched scream and bites your hand with abnormally sharp teeth.

You scream in pain, horror, and shock, watching the blood trickle down your arm and dribble onto his uniform. You writhe and twist, trying to get out of his grip, but only make his teeth dig into you more painfully.

He finally stops biting you, but without loosening his grip on your hand, he looks up at you devilishly and licks your blood off his lips, his eyes glowing red. Like your blood.
121212.title: So you're a biter, eh?

1212121.content:
You pull out your PLS with your other hand, and Alex doesn't have time to react as you point it at his head and fire.

Nothing happens.

He seems to absorb the power surge from the PLS. You fire again. And again. And again. Again, again, again. Click click click. Out of power. He took all the PLS bursts as though you were touching him with a slightly chilly spoon.

Alex smiles at you again. That inhuman, evil smile. He waves his finger at you chidingly, "Tsk tsk tsk."

He leaps to your throat and bites down.

"This bites." You think as everything turns to dark.
1212121.title: Rawrrrrrr!

1212122.content:
You bring you knee up hard to his stomach, and Alex doubles over in pain, wheezing for breath and dropping hold of your arm.

You quickly take the opportunity to turn around and run as fast as you can, cradling your bleeding arm as you stagger down the hall.

"TRISH!" Alex screams behind you.

He must be regaining himself and chasing you now.

You run harder, taking twists and turns in the halls, hoping you don't forget the way around in your desperation.

Suddenly you bump into someone and scream.
1212122.title: Take that, bucko!

choices: "Let's go back and see who it is." As he pulls his PLS
"Okay, let's go." As he pulls you along and starts to run.
12121221.content:
You scream as you realize it's Alex, and start to turn and run the other way when he grabs your wounded arm to stop you. He easily over powers you and pulls you around to him.

"Trish! What's the matter?" He looks at you concernedly.

"GET AWAY!" You scream, trying to wriggle free, using your free arm to pummel against his chest. Suddenly you realize his uniform doesn't have any blood on it. Neither does his face. "But you..."

"Trish, what happened?" He discovers the wound on your wrist and arm and winces as he examines it.

"You... you bit me!"

"ME?" Alex shouts incredulously. "Listen, I was on the bridge with Brea until just a couple minutes ago and obviously you've been hallucinating or something... ... hey, what's that?"

You hear the shouting of someone coming down the hall in chase. Alex?

"Listen." You take a deep breath and try to explain. "Someone or something that looked just like you bit my arm and now he's chasing us. We HAVE to get out of here!"

He looks at you, trying to decide if what you're saying has any merit to it, and says
12121221.title: ALEX!? Again!? No!

choices: A kiss from your favorite movie star?
12121222.content:
You realize it's Dana. Oh thank goodness.

"Dana! Alex went crazy and he's trying to EAT me or something!" You shout, showing her your wound.

Her face remains calm. "Trish, what are you talking about?"

"Come ON! We have to get out of here! He's following me!" You try to urge her on and get past her.

She blocks your path. "Hmmm.... Let me think about that. No." She locks gazes with you and smiles. The smile is strange. You can't put your finger on why or how. But it's... strange. Suddenly her eyes glow red for an instant and then back to blue.

You realize she's gone mad or ... whatever happened to Alex, too! Before you can react physically, though, she reaches out and grabs your wounded wrist. You hiss in pain as she leans forward a little.

She juts her head forward a little and grins. "Boo."

You scream as her face melts in on itself. Then it rebuilds itself as different crewmembers. Brea. Dos. Alex. You.

"Hi honey." The you-lookalike says with your voice.

Behind you you hear your voice again, "Well well well."

Looking over your shoulder, you see another you-look-alike standing at the end of the hall, its uniform stained with your blood.

Wide-eyed you turn back to the you-look-alike holding your wrist and begin to squirm.

"Now hold still while I suck your juices." It says to you.

"It's really not as painful as it sounds." The other one chimes in stepping in closer behind you. "Well, at least not once you're dead. But that won't be for awhile at least. Better enjoy the few moments you have left to live." It chuckles.

"Any last requests?" The one holding your wrist leans in close to your face and hisses at you.
12121222.title: It's you! And... you!

choices: Turn and run to find the captain
Use the gun as a bludgeon and beat the crap outta them freaks
121212221.content:
"A drink?" you ask sweetly.

The look-alike-you stops confusedly and blinks. "Excuse me?" It started to say.

You pick up your knees and slam them into 'your' own gut. 'You' double over and start to choke violently. The other alien barrels at you as you duck to the side, causing the alien to trip over his partner. You pull out your PLS, but relize it won't do you any good.

You...
121212221.title: Go Human Power!!!

12122.content:
"I don't think so, buddy!" You shout, quickly kneeing him in the groin. "Hyah! Take that!"

He doubles over in pain, grumbling, groaning, moaning... or all three, it's not clear.

Not wasting any time, you pull out your PLS and train it on him hastily. "Alright, buster, WHAT'S going on here!?"

Alex looks up at you in pain and opens his mouth as if to speak, but can't seem to force enough air out to make the sounds. Finally, he says...
12122.title: Hiya!

122.content:
"Well there's the problem!" You exclaim happily, "Now to reconnect it..." Carefully, you bring the wire together with the circuit board. A flash of light temporarily blinds you, but you adjust to it slowly, realizing the power has come back on.

"Yippee." You slam the power cell's door shut and kick some rubble out of your path.

"Time to go meet the family." You mutter, picking your way out.
122.title: A Sparking Wire!!

choices: Something capable of causing mass destruction!
1221.content:
A small group of people catches your eye as you step outside the airlock. They're huddled around some sort of machinery... probably a computer or something.

You walk to them, and peer over their heads at the thing. You recognize the logo on the side.

"The Optitrope?" You half gasp.

Kal swallowed hard, "We don't have any choice. We have to... well..."

"I'm going to need 3 teams of 3 to collect the power cells from the ship." Brea barked orders and the crew scrambled trying to fulfill them. Dana, Alex and Kal formed one group, as Kamira, Lamara, and Chris formed another. The final group was quickly put together as Anorian, Garonen and Dos ran onto the ship.

You're now alone with Brea, the captain, and Gemini, the medic. "Captain, why did you bring that thing out? I thought you said--"

"I know I said we could fix the ship. But..." Brea faltered, "It's a little bit more complicated than that."

Gemini cut in "We're running out of supplies, Trish."

"Oh." You murmur.

"We have to use it." Brea declared, "There's just no way around it."

The wind picked up and blew through the alien vegetation, purple/gray with blooms.

The optitrope is...
1221.title: The Optitrope

choices: "I'll get the passcodes from the bridge."
"I'll go to the Lab for the report and then take the skimmer out."
12211.content:
"But the Optitrope signal could take months to get back to Terra." You half protest and half say to yourself.

"Trish, I know. What do you want me to do about that? The sooner we send the signal, the better." Brea sits down and begins to fiddle with the optitrope in a somewhat feeble attempt to assemble it.

"You want some help?" Gemini ventures humbly.

"No." Brea grunts and hoists herself back onto her feet. "I need one of you to get on the bridge and pick up the passcodes and coordinates for Terra and this planet." She looks up at the sun and clouds, "And the other needs to go to the Lab, get the brief report on this planet, and then take the skimmer out to make a small map of the surrounding few miles."

"Which one do you want to do?" Gemini faces you.
12211.title: A communication device, of course....

choices: Calibrate the ions! Dangerous, but important.
12212.content:
"I really don't see what good destroying everyone and the planet is going to do." You say hotly.

Brea looks exasperated at first, but then sighs, "We're modifying the Optitrope to do more than what it was designed to do. Obviously at first it was designed to be a gigantic laser capable of destroying anything and everything. Gemini and I are working to turn it into a beacon. A rescue beacon. Now do you understand?"

"Ohhh." You finally understand what's going on. After this has had a moment to sink in you ask, "What can I do to help? I notice you sent everyone else off..."

"Yeah, we have a special job for you." Brea says.
12212.title: KABOOM!

choices: Step on her foot as you go over. That wench!
Just do it. No need to get worked up...
122121.content:
Gemini grins and holds out a little flashlight to you. "You hold the flashlight."

"While we work." Brea giggles a little and then bends over the optitrope circuitry.

You glare. Just because you're a little clumsy doesn't mean you can't do anything of worth! How mean!

"Uh, Trish?" Gemini says curtly, "Light?"

"Uh huh." You click the light on and hold it over the Optitrope board.

"Any way you could maybe bring that a little over this way, Trish?" Gemini says, clearly loving the idea that you're holding the flashlight while she works.

"Sure thing, Gem."
122121.title: Flashlight

choices: "Trish! I'll put you in the barracks for this!"
1221211.content:
You step on her foot on purpose as you maneuver your way over.

"OW!" She screams, knocking a micro-board on the ground.

Uh oh. "I'm sorry! I didn't mean to!" You try desperately to sound sincere.

"YEAH RIGHT!" Gemini screams.

"Oh my God." You murmur. The micro-board is split down the middle.

Brea screams...
1221211.title: heeheehee take that!

12212111.content:
Brea screams "That was connected to the trigger!"

Well, she started to.

Just about at the syllable "nect," the Optitrope laser exploded, incinerating everyone at the scene instantly, and then everything else on the surface of the planet in a matter of seconds. The entire planet explodes, sending tiny pieces of you out into space at tremendous speeds. The pieces of you freeze, spread out, and eventually travel the length of the Universe. Hey, you always said you wanted to see the Universe...
12212111.title: BOOOOM!

123.content: "Yay! Money!" You pick up the coin and stuff it in your pocket. Whistling happily, you continue trying to fix the stupid pipe. Suddenly, you hear a strange noise... almost like a slithering... and it seems to be coming from overhead. Cautiously you put down your wrench and haul yourself up to investigate. There doesn't seem to be anything there, but the noise is getting louder. You poke your head into the air duct and look around. Suddenly, something touches your shoulder!
123.title: Whazzat?

choices: Try to fight it off yourself
Use your 'com and call for help
1231.content: "AAAAAHHHHHH!!!!" You scream loudly at the unexpected contact. Something is wrapping around you! You look and see that there is a black rope oozing out of your pocket and slowly wrapping itself around your neck. You fall backwards into the air duct and struggle with the slimy black mass.
1231.title: Oh no!

choices: Shoot it first, ask questions later...
I'll take my chances fighting without those violent guns, thank you
12311.content:
"AAAAAAAGGGGGHHHHH!" You attempt to fight back! Using your arms and legs, vainly trying to get the black thing off of you! It's stuck fast to you.

You reach for your PLS, quick fire! wait... if you fire on it, you might accidentally shoot yourself! Or the beam could go right through the alien!

On the other hand, everything else seems to be failing...

Quick you're running out of air...
12311.title: *gasp!*

12312.content:
As you are pulled into the air duct by the leathery type rope, you struggle to reach your com to call for help.
You are pulled through a maze of air ducts with the ropes wrapping around your body . All of a sudden you get stuck in one of the ducts. Your com pops out and lands by your head. You strain your neck to try and dial. More ropes enter the ducts and grab you by the ankles pulling you down.
Stuck again.
With the com in your mouth you have mad a connection. " Help! can anyone hear me? Help! I'm stuck in the air ducts."
The ropes seem to be alive and pull you down harder. Ahhh, a break, The ropes pulled so hard your boots came off. Now your just trapped. "Hello, said a voice on the com, How can I help you?"
12312.title: trapped.

123122.content: Maybe I can slide down the ducts a little at a time and find a way out. As you inch your way down you find yourself wedged even tighter. Your feet feel like they have just broken through and opening but you can't go any further. How will I get out of this. Something suddenly grabs your ankles. "Good , you think, something is trying to pull me out." What ever it is isn't pulling very hard though. " Hey, cut it out. He hee , Whats going on down ha ha ha there." There was something tickling the bottom of your feet. It was fluff creatures. Feathery little rabbit like creatures. You must have broken through one of their cages. " Hee hee, This is a hee ha hoo hoo very hee hee ticklish ha ha situation. How will I hee hee get out of ha ha this?"
123122.title: ticklish situation.

choices: Kimira is attcked by an alien before she can free you.
1231221.content:
You finally reach someone on your com.

"Hello." says a voice. It's Kamira Roberts.

"Kimira, hee hee, You've got to help me. I have just landed in your lab and I need you to help me out right away."

"Sure, said Kamira, I'll be there in a few minutes. Why are you laughing? "

"I'll he hee,explain everything later. Please hurry."

As Kimira entered the room, she soon saw what you were laughing about. She giggled at the situation.

Kimira moved the cage away from your feet and took the tiny creatures off.

"Get me outta here." You yell to her.

"Sure thing." said Kimira tickling your feet .

" Hey, Cut that out, you say, and get me out!"

"Sorry, says Kimira, I couldn't resist. Let me help you out."
1231221.title: Ahhh,  a little help.

choices: You scramble back up the air duct.
12312212.content:
As Kimira pulls at your ankels to free you, you hear a loud crash. " Kimira?, Kimira? are you there? are you ok?"
No answer. Whats going on. Suddenly you feel something pulling on your ankels again to free you.
" Hey, Kimira's hands weren't slimy . Somebody help me!!!"
12312212.title: Alien surprise.

choices: Go outside to see what the captain wants
Stay to work on the pipes
1232.content:
You instantly spin and begin beating the crap out of whatever is behind you.

"Ow! Ow! Ow! Stoppit!"

You stop beating, only to discover that you are hitting not some horrible monster, but Anorian Johnson.

"Oops. Sorry, Anorian."

Anorian grumbles, rubbing his head. "Captain Marlson sent me in to get you. She wants you outside pronto."
1232.title: Oops...

choices: The top decks with Alex Reed
The bottom decks with Dana Pendrell
12321.content:
"Oh alright." You toss your hammer aside, nearly whacking Anorian in the face.

"Hey! That almost hit me!" Anorian cried, ducking and covering himself protectively. "And what were you using that hammer for, anyway?"

"Hammering."

Upon arriving outside you immediately see the makeshift camp that has been set up; Brea standing in the middle and ordering people around like a military sergeant. She sees you and waves her arms. Apparently she wants you to come closer.

You casually stroll over to her and plop down in an empty chair. "Yeah, Captain?"

"Officer Barrak, Officer O'connor is missing and we need to find him. I'm afraid he may have been injured somehow and is now lying somewhere unable to contact us."

"Did he survive the crash?" You ask

"Yes, I just spoke to him 40 minutes ago. He said he was going to the galley. When I went to find him he wasn't there."

"And... you want me to go look for him?" You shift uncomfortably in your chair.

"Either you can go with Alex Reed to the top decks, or Dana Pendrell to the bottom decks." Brea said, and then leaned forward to whisper, "I need to keep those two seperated."
12321.title: Going outside... and...

choices: He leans forward and kisses you!
He morphs into an ugly alien and tries to eat you!
123211.content:
Thinking about Dana's bad temper you decide, "I'll take my chances with Alex..." You leave and begin heading toward the top decks.

Alex joins you momentarily. "Hi, Trish!" He says cheerily.

"Hi, Alex." You slur. You're not in a good mood. What you really want is some coffee. Why can't you find any coffee in the joint? "Did you make coffee this morning Alex?"

"Why, yes I did. Let's go to the galley to get some." Alex suggests.

You follow enthusiastically at first, and then you get suspicious. First of all, Alex is never this nice, second, Alex never makes coffee.

Cautiously, you follow.

When in the galley, you walk over to the counter, hunting for coffee. "Alex, I thought you said you made--"

Alex grabs your arm and pushes you backward against the fridge (coolant unit).

You watch, wide-eyed as...
123211.title: I'll go with Alex... Was this a mistake?

1232111.author_name: I'm too young for this site
1232111.content:
"WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!" You scream, shoving him away from you.

"Sorry," Alex answers nervously. "But I've liked you ever since we started this mission. I just couldn't show it. And, you chose me to explore with you. I thought that meant you liked me too!"

"You mean...you're STRAIGHT?" you ask, dumfounded. "You like girls?"

Alex blinks at you for a moment. "Well, sorta," he says, twitching nervously. "I mean, I don't really mind...uh...either. Hey! We should go, it's getting late!" With that, he quickly shuffles out of the galley.

You scratch your head, puzzled. What is up with him?
1232111.title: Weirdo

choices: Umm... Miss... are you an alien?
123212.content:
"Come on." Dana says, gruffly grabbing your shoulder, "Time to go."

You rub your shoulder and wince, "Isn't she in a good mood," You mumble.

"What was that?!" Dana turns around, her eyes flashing with red.

You shrink away, "Nothing... Nothing..."

Suddenly you realize that she is not taking you to the bottom decks like she's supposed to... "Dana, where are we going?"

She turns around again, her eyes still hinting with red, "Wouldn't you like to know..." She flashes her teeth, which look menacing... and scary.

Uh oh... you know those aliens have red eyes! maybe one shapeshifted into Dana!

What do you do?

Kill her?

or

Ask her if she's an alien?
123212.title: Dana Jean, the Beauty Queen

13.content:
You scream "Die Captain!!" and run forward madly.

Captain Marlson is taken by surprise, and watches as you barrel into her. Both of you fall backwards screaming.

You bite her madly and punch her repeatedly, kicking your legs and yelling like a lunatic. Suddenly, you feel a hot beam of something cut through your chest and your legs and arms go numb.

Captain Marlson watches as you close your eyes, and die. She puts away her PLS and smiles, her eyes glowing red.
13.title: "Die Captain!!"

info.brief_description: Meet the crew of the Luna in a serious comedy adventure, remember: you're the star!
info.description:
Killer Aliens From Space!


So you wanna find out if you have the guts to be a crewmember of the Luna? Let's see if you can survive this excitingly scary and at times hilarious adventure.

In this story you'll be playing the part of either Trish Barrak or Devin Porter (Obviously you will choose Trish if you are a girl and Devin if you are a boy... but of course you can switch if you want, you know, and choose the opposite one)

The Luna is a spaceship in the year 2455 which has (at this point in the story) crash landed on a planet far away from Earth (which will be can be called Terra in this story). The real bad part comes when they find out who else is on that planet. It turns out that the planet is inhabited by an extremely hostile alien species (of course!) called the zylogigs. Pretty typical? Well maybe, except for the fact that these aliens can shapeshift to look like anything or anyone. That can be a problem.

Your character must try to rescue the crew of the Luna before everyone (including you) is eaten up by those nasty aliens. Now to brief you for your mission:

Weapons:
PLS---Mostly referred to as PLS but sometimes referred to as a Pulse Laser Shooter. It's a nice, revolver sized gun which is very powerful, but pretty much ineffective against the zylogigs due to their alien genetics which makes that particular type of laser basically useless.

Melamine Phaser---A small weapon with little actual fire power. Usually good for humans, but it's like sprinkling water on a bonfire when it comes to zylogigs.

Pipes and other parts of the ship---Generally good for combatting zylogigs as you can hit them over the head with these misc. pieces. One word of warning though: Bashing their head in won't kill them because their brains are located in their stomachs.

Characters:
Trish Barrak: A 23 year-old engineer who has short brown hair (above shoulder length) and dark brown eyes. She cracks jokes when she's nervous or uncomfortable and isn't very sociable in general.

Devin Porter: A 25 year-old chemist with black hair and blue eyes. He's usually a pretty warm and sociable kind of guy who's very witty and clever.

Non-Playable Characters
(Characters which can appear in the story but you can't *BE*)
Brea Marlson: The captain of the Luna. She's stubborn and likes things done her way. She has an iron fist and fiery temper to match her red hair.

Kal O'Connor: 2nd in command of the Luna. He's cowboy-ish and truely Texan in nature. With a flashing pearly smile it's no wonder he's married with children (two small girls).

Alex Reed: Computer Specialist who constantly gets in fights with Dana Pendrell. The two are almost inseperable like brothers and sisters who love to fight.

Dana Pendrell: Physicist with short red hair and blue eyes (the one who fights with Alex Reed). She's cute, but try not to get in her way or she just might rip you limb from limb.

Kamira Roberts: Head Scientist of the Luna. She has grey eyes and long black hair. She usually wears glasses and has a very good temperament usually, but sometimes she gets so mad she's scary.

Anorian Johnson: Squirmish yet lovable. Faints at the sight of blood and vomits when stressed or views something unpleasant.

Dos Gray:An old, bitter engineer who hates almost everything. He complains all the time and has a typically bad attitude.

I know that's a lot of characters, but those are all you can have so you should be grateful so many are included, lol. Don't worry, you don't have to use all of them *grin*. Just have fun!!

So now you are ready to begin. When you come to a dead end *PLEASE* write a new chapter! I'll even email you with thanks if you do! ***NEW*** And you get a link to your portfolio posted right here.

Thanks to rikuna for writing 3 great chapters!! She has been awarded 500 Gift Points for writing those wonderful chapters!
